captions.text: <i>Give me a Tab.</i>

I can't give you a tab
unless you order something.
Right. Give me a Pepsi Free.

MAN: You want a Pepsi, pal,
you're going to pay for it.

Just give me something
without any sugar in it, okay?
Something without sugar.
[Door opens]
BIFF: McFly.
What are you doing?
Biff.
I'm talking to you, McFly, you Irish bug!

GEORGE: Biff. Guys. How are you doing?
BIFF: You got my homework finished?

Actually, I figured
since it wasn't due 'til Monday...
Hello? Hello? Anybody home?
Think, McFly. Think!
I got to have time to recopy it.

You realize what would happen if I hand in
my homework in your handwriting?
I'll get kicked out of school.

You wouldn't want that to happen,
would you?

- Would you?
- Of course not.

- No.
- I wouldn't want that to happen.

- What are you looking at, butthead?
- Get a load of his life preserver.
Dork thinks he's going to drown.
BIFF: How about my homework, McFly?
Okay, Biff.

I'll finish that up tonight and then I'll
bring it over first thing tomorrow morning.

Not too early. I sleep in Sundays.
Your shoe's untied!
Don't be so gullible, McFly.

- I don't want to see you in here again.
- Okay. All right. Bye-bye.

- What?
- You're George McFly!
Yeah. Who are you?

Why do you let those boys
push you around like that for?
They're bigger than me.
Stand tall. Have some respect for yourself.

If you let people walk over you now,
they'll walk over you the rest of your life.

Look at me. You think
I'll spend my life in this slop house?

MAN: Watch it, Goldie.
GOLDIE: No, sir!

GOLDIE: I'll do something.
I'll go to night school.
One day, I'm going to be somebody.
That's right. He's going to be mayor.
Yeah, I'm...
Mayor!

Now that's a good idea!
I could run for mayor.

- A colored mayor. That'll be the day.
- Wait and see. I will be mayor.

I'll be the most powerful man
in Hill Valley...
...and I'm going to clean up this town.
Good. You can start by sweeping the floor.
Mayor Goldie Wilson.
I like the sound of that.
[Bicycle bell rings]
Hey, Dad! George! Hey, you on the bike!

title: Back to the Future (4/10) Movie CLIP - You're George McFly! (1985) HD

played Biff Tannen, Griff Tannen and Buford "Mad Dog" Tannen in the Back to

comments.text:
+gothatway09
Even more good points. I didn't even think of that, how the hell did he use 
the phone? What you said about the coins being old that made senses. 
There's a lot of errors in this movie. But i still love it don't get me 
wrong. Even in the third movie, remember when the delorean wouldn't work? 
They needed gas. Well didn't the dock leave the car hidden so Marty could 
get it in the future? And Marty went back to the dock so why didn't they 
just take the gas from the hidden car? It would have saved them trouble. 
Because they used a train to make the car go up to 88 miles per hour.
comments.author: Patrick O'Riley

comments.text:
+Patrick O'Riley I always wondered that too.  How did his 80s money work so 
well and accepted so easily in the 1950s.  Granted he could have had some 
very old coins in his pocket, there are coins from the 1970s still in 
circulation today,.....but really?  It was still something of a stretch.  
Marty pays for his coffee and uses the pay phone.  A pay phone with a 
rotary dial.  Hey I grew up in the 80s, and while I did know "what" a 
rotary phone was (since there were plenty of old movies and old TV shows in 
reruns all the time in the 80s, so you had an idea of past technology like 
rotary phones and slide rulers), I sure as hell don't remember seeing 
ANYONE using a rotary phone in the 80s.  Not in the early 80s or late 80s.  
Granted I was young, but I don't remember rotary phones in public 
or private places.  So it was weird they made such a big scene about Marty 
having trouble opening a Coke bottle from the 1950s, but he so easily 
figured out the rotary phone.
comments.author: gothatway09

comments.text:
Here's my question. How did, Marty, pay for his drink? The money he would 
have would be from the future so how come he was able to buy coffee? 
Wouldn't the owner say what the fuck is this? And accuse him of giving fake 
money? Either way i still love this movie! I grew up with it. There's 
mistakes, but it's still a classic.
comments.author: Patrick O'Riley

comments.text: +gothatway09 Yeah you're right
comments.author: Pammie Moore

comments.text:
+Pammie Moore The Back to the Future movies in addition to showing off the 
friendship of Marty and Doc, were also all about the various aspects 
of "being a man".  The first movie was Marty teaching George to stand up 
for himself, even with physical force if necessary.  The sequels were about 
Marty himself learning from both Doc and Seamus to reel it in a bit, and 
when man has to know to walk away and let words just be words.  Seamus 
wasn't a confrontational man like his brother Martin that got stabbed, or 
like his great great grandson Marty, but he didn't let what people said 
affect him.  Seamus wasn't a pushover, whereas it was clear George McFly 
and Marty's son Marty Jr were guys who let stuff get under their skin and 
were total doormats.
comments.author: gothatway09

comments.text: +Pammie Moore Mm! Good point!

comments.text:

argument.

comments.author: Robert Dominguez

comments.text:
+elcap22 
Blu-ray is 1920x1080p. Cameras that shoot on film don't really have a 
resolution, but if you digitally scan the film you can probably get 
3840x2160p out of traditional 35mm film, yes. 
Both Lawrence of Arabia and The Sound of Music had their 70mm film 
rescanned at 8k to create the blu-rays at the highest quality possible and 
so they could digitally work with it at the highest level.
comments.author: Usul573

comments.text:
+Usul573 I thought movie cameras, even back in the 70s were four times

comments.author: Jack Dotson

comments.text:
Most of the mistakes can be explained by Docs and Martys from other 
timelines appearing into the "movie timelines" from other realities.  Doc 
is mistaken and doesn't fully understand that the time jumps are not always 
the exact same reality.  When Marty left 1985 for 2015, he went to another 
reality and a Marty from some other timeline landed in 1985 so he was not 
seeing himself but an older Marty from yet another timeline. There was a 
timeline where Marty disappeared forever.  The universe did this to balance 
things out to self-heal from riffs that could destroy the fabric of time. 
 Doc was mistaken about universe-ending paradoxes.  The universe has time 
travel healing designed into it.  Doc wasn't that great of a scientist. 
 The time machine was a fluke--inspired more by the mysticism of inspired 
psychic vision that scientific talent (as shown in the movie that the head 
bump brought a vision of the flex capacitor.)  The greatest truth that Doc 
and Marty did not figure out was that Timelords were interacting with Doc 
and Marty and moving the plot along for their own amusement.﻿
comments.author: VelvetRevolution0000
